basics.name: Aakash Gupta

basics.summary: A curious programmer who loves to learn new skills, and questions the workings of everything.

work.name: Nutanix
work.summary: Worked on migration of code from python 2 to python 3.
highlights: Migrated code from python2 to python3 for core-infra team.
Tested functional code using Mock and Mox in both python2 and 3 for backward compatibility.
Completed code coverage of core-infra codebase upto 90% from 30%.

work.name: CryptoPool
work.summary: Working with the founder to manage the development of payment gateway system for cryptocurrencies.
highlights: Working with the developer team and resolving blockers.
Resolving technical doubts of clients, investors and service providers.
Continuous code reviews for the code developed by team.

work.name: D. E. Shaw India Private Limited
work.summary: Designed and implemented a rule language to generate alerts based on market activities.
highlights: Designed a Domain Specific Language (DSL) for Alert Generation based on market activities.
Implemented the interpreter for DSL in python.
Worked with streaming data from market.
Designed NoSQL database to store all relevant details for alert generation.
Implemented the public API for the creation, modification and management of alerts in whole system.

work.name: Kalam Labs
work.description: Helps in education via Augmented Reality
work.summary: Worked as game developer for science experiments and worked an development of core products in company.
highlights: Built NCERT simulations on Unity and Vuforia SDK.
Implemented the interface for using the SpiceSharp (C# library for electric circuit simulation) in Unity.
Worked on Reliance Tesseract AR HMD Holoboard SDK for simulation in Unity3D.

work.name: DYBOâ„¢
work.summary: Worked with the founders to develop core logic for mobile application.
highlights: Implemented Page Navigation with message passing in Unity3D.
Managed C# code for API calls and cached data on disk for less internet usage and server load.
Implemented Boss-Worker model of multithreading for calling server for data and making race free code for GUI.
Implemented storage manager for mapping disk storage location from URL path and file versions.
Generated color theme in C# code from RGB array of image.

work.name: Kalam Labs
work.description: Helps in education via Augmented Reality
work.summary: Developed various models for NCERT Science Experiments in AR.
highlights: Developed various simulations for NCERT experiments on Unity and Vuforia as marker based AR.
Created models for NCERT experiments in blender and used them as Augmented Reality prefabs.
Rebuilt script for dynamic loading of models in mobile device and enhanced support for developers.

volunteer.summary: Managed the newly openend competitive programming team of Club.
highlights: Rebuilt the recruitment process taking past recruitment problems into consideration.
Conducted weekly 2 hour lectures on competitive programming algorithms and data structures.
Gave coding assignments to juniors to complete, assessed them on their code and gave constructive feedback on their implementations.
Conducted written tests on theory after teaching them and giving them resources to learn.
Assisted club juniors in development of layout of topics in competitive sessions for internship and placement preparations.
Took placement preparation sessions on prefix sum, binary search, dynamic programming and linked lists, tree traversals and backtracking.
Gave coding assignments from leetcode relevant to the topics in placement sessions.

volunteer.position: Teaching Assistant in Neural Networks and Fuzzy Logic
volunteer.summary: NNFL course covers various topics related to neural networks, including but not limited to ANN, optimizations and Fuzzy Logic.
highlights: Created assignment on K-means for the course
Handled different research papers on neural networks for 5 different groups on CNN. Assisted them in case of any problems.

volunteer.position: Teaching Assistant in Graphs and Networks
volunteer.summary: This course covers graph theory from theoretical point of view including graph traversals, trees, flows, coloring, etc.
highlights: Assisted instructor by preparing questions on different topics in graph theory related to course.
Prepared tutorial sheets for class of 90+ students.

education.institution: Birla Institute of Technology and Science, Pilani
education.area: Msc. Mathematics and B.E. Computer Science

awards.title: Best Student Award
awards.summary: Received the award for achieving the highest grades in our mathematics batch.

awards.title: First prize in campus wide scholarship test
awards.summary: Alphagrep Securities conducted a scholarship exam in our campus in which first prize winner can win 3 laakh rupees. Questions were based on Competitive Coding Test.

certificates.name: Blockchain A-Zâ„¢: Learn How To Build Your First Blockchain

projects.name: Accounting system
projects.description: Implemented the accounting system in C++.
projects.summary: For personal financial expense tracking and reporting, learned and implemented accounting system in C++.
highlights: Implemented non-owning and owning parsers for HTML, CSV and JSON.
Added various parsers for bank statement, SMS, Gmail, Rapido, Uber, Swiggy, etc in C++.
Added support for Journal entries, ledger book and balance sheet.
Added proper support for location overrides for Rapido/Uber, and added support to override data.
Worked with GMAIL API in python, and implemented .lldbinit file for custom view of data structures in debugger.
Implemeted single threaded server in C++ using Boost library and migrated the data handling from file system to MYSQL database.
Worked with Postgres and MYSQL database API in C++ and added data consistency checks for all CRUD operations.
Implemented a frontend app using ReactJS and cursor.
Containerized the application for GCC 15.1 and CMAKE 3.30 support of modules.
Used functional data-types for error handling and logging errors.

projects.name: Asynchronous scheduler in C++
projects.description: Implemented the nodejs like scheduler in C++ using coroutines.
projects.summary: To achieve asynchronous programming in singlethread, implemented the async-await mechanism of node-js using C++ coroutines, which runs CPU task in main thread and I/O tasks in thread pool.
highlights: Used coroutines to implement Nodejs like event-loop in C++.
Used main thread for CPU task and threadpool to distribute I/O bound tasks.
Implemented thread-safe time-based priorirty queue in C++ using mutex and condition variables.

projects.name: Java streams implementation in C++
projects.summary: Replicated Java-stream API in C++ using C++ iterator API.
highlights: Implemented Java-streams API using C++ iterators.
Handled lifetime issues with separate handling for temporary containers and non-owning containers.

projects.name: Compile Time Parser
projects.description: Compile time LL(1) parser in C++
projects.summary: Implemented a compile time LL(1) parser in C++ using constexpr and consteval features.
highlights: Implemented constexpr compatible shared pointer, flatmap and generic enum<->string support
Implemented State-Machine-Driven Lexical analyser using longest match algorithm.
Implemented Top-down LL(1) parser using first, follow and selection sets, and generated parser table at compile time.
Added proper recorvery support in parser and generated compile-time static_assert messages.
Implemented the visitor pattern to convert parsed tree into DSL specific AST.
Added JSON parser as PoC for testing.
Learned C++ modules and migrated the project to modules.

projects.name: Computer from scratch
projects.description: Project for creation of computer system from scratch.
projects.summary: A virtual hardware with complete support for compiling, assembling, executing programs written in Jack Programming Language.
highlights: Implemented CPU simulator in C++.
Implemented assembler to convert assembly to binary code.
Implemented VM Translator to translate bytecode to assembly.

projects.name: Hadoop and Spark Microservices
projects.description: Built a microservice to search words in a collection of dataset in Hadoop and Spark as part of Cloud Computing coursework.
projects.summary: Built a microservice to search words in a collection of dataset in Hadoop and Spark as part of Cloud Computing coursework.
highlights: Developed a Java-based solution using Hadoop and Spark to implement word search functionality across multiple files.
Designed and developed a mediator using NodeJS to handle user requests and direct them to the appropriate Hadoop or Spark service based on user arguments.
Enhanced the file search feature by adding support for ANY or ALL word searches from a provided list of words.

projects.name: Network Programming Shell and Servers
projects.description: Network Programming projects in which we created a shell using Linux system calls, news subscription system and longest common router path to other servers.
projects.summary: Network Programming projects in which we created a shell using Linux system calls, news subscription system and longest common router path to other servers.
highlights: Developed a Linux shell in C++ using system calls with advanced features such as pipes, message queues, IO redirection, background/foreground processes, and daemon commands.
Utilized socket API to establish a ring topology for servers, which allowed for parallel clients, push and retrieve messages, and inter-server communications.
Designed two client APIs for publishing messages and retrieving both messages and file contents from servers.
Implemented a message header for communications and ensured synchronization between servers and clients.
Leveraged RAW Sockets to obtain the IP address of the longest common router from a device to a set of URLs.

projects.name: Parallelize Huffman coding
projects.description: Parallel Computing project for BITS Course which parallelize the encoding and decoding using huffman coding.
projects.summary: Parallel Computing project for BITS Course which parallelize the encoding and decoding using huffman coding.
highlights: Successfully designed and implemented parallel computation of Huffman encoding and decoding utilizing MPI.
Conducted comprehensive complexity analysis and scalability computations to evaluate system performance.

projects.name: Compiler
projects.description: Compiler project for BITS course which converts high level language to assembly.
projects.summary: Compiler project for BITS course which converts high level language to assembly.
highlights: Implemented all phases of compiler in C: lexer, parser, type checker, code generation, etc.
Generated appropriate error messages for invalid syntax/data types.
Generated assembly to support arrays, structs, unions and function calls.

projects.name: Time Table Visualizer
projects.description: Windows 10 time table visualizer for the courses offered in BITS Pilani.
projects.summary: Windows 10 time table visualizer for the courses offered in BITS Pilani.
highlights: Designed and developed a tool that parses the Excel format of a timetable and converts it into a JSON format that is readable by UWP applications.
Created a user-friendly interface that allows users to select various courses and visualize their timetables in a grid format.
Incorporated a collision detection feature that alerts users in case of multiple classes scheduled at the same time, providing a more comprehensive and efficient scheduling solution.

projects.name: Calculator for Coordinate Geometry
projects.description: A simple calculator which calculates various parameters related to lines, circle and conic sections for NCERT class XI mathematics problems.
highlights: Developed a program that handles lines and various types of questions related to them, while also plotting them on a side window.
Implemented circle equation calculations using various methods, including center and radius, two diameter points, and more.
Created a tool that can calculate the properties of conic sections from multiple representations, providing a comprehensive analysis of these complex geometric shapes.
